page.title: 18Religion in Bwlch-y-groes.
page.content: There are two chapels and two churches in our block.One church,Cilrhedyn Church is a ruin.Clydau and Cilrhedyn are both Anglican churches.They are both Celtic churches with circular graveyards and are about 1500 years old.There are two other chapels. Llwyndrain Chapel which is Congregationalist and Star which is a Baptist Chapel.I do not go to church but I used to go to Sunday School.I left because I did not like it.The three ogham stones inside Clydau Church are gravestones of Irish noblemen who lived in our area in the 5th to 7th centuries.One of the stones was found on Dygoed Farm,my home.In 1829,a preacher named David Wilcock was walking down the hill to Star by Nant Ifan-fawr when he saw a shooting star land on some rocks above the village and he built his chapel there.
